channel.title: Spell Check/ Grammar Check on summary
channel.description:
Please spell check it and grammar check it. I already did the most I can find. It would be helpful if you helped me .
Well here it is:
[code]Nigeria pumps over 2.5 million gallons of oil a year. Children and forced to pump the oil for little or no pay at all.Nigeria is one of the worlds biggest oil providers.. The oil reserves are worth over 2 TRILLION dollars. but very few people get the wealth from the oil. The economy and government is corrupt. 99% of that money is either stolen by government officials directed to powerful peoples bank accounts. Kids are starting jobs at the age of 10. The jobs vary from head loader, hawker, grinder, valcanizer and much more. Martha Dung age of 12 had a near slavery experience. Her parents died so she had to live her aunt. One day her aunt told her to call a stranger uncle and obey him at all times. Then she was taken away by him to some family to work for them. She had to do a lot of the work there. One day the police caught the man she call uncle and arrested him. Now she lives in a shelter. Abraham is 14 and works as a vulcanizer. He repairs tires that have been pooped or punctured. He has to live in a horrible environment everyday. He can’t see his parents becuase he doesn’t have enough money. He sleeps where he works. Sekinat is 13 and is a hawker, he sets up tables and sells goods on them. It may seem like an easy job and first, but there is a big change you might get run over by a car. His foot got run over by a car once and now its broken. Soddeg is 14 and works as a grinder. he grinds yams into a fine powder called fufu. it is a popular food. Grinding is very dangerous and with all the powder everywhere you can easily suffocate to death while you work.[/code]
P.S. This is from Junior Scholastic

item.title: Spell Check/ Grammar Check on summary
item.dc:creator: @ninja_nub ninja nub
item.description:
@ninja_nub wrote:

[quote=“swordslaser9, post:1, topic:174008”]Please spell check it and grammar check it. I already did the most I can find. It would be helpful if you helped me .

Well here it is:

Nigeria pumps over 2.5 million gallons of oil a year. Children and forced  to pump the oil for little or no pay at all. Nigeria is one of the worlds biggest oil providers.. The oil reserves are worth over 2 TRILLION dollars. but very few people get the wealth from the oil. The economy and government is corrupt. 99% of that money is either stolen by government officials directed  to powerful peoples bank accounts. Kids are starting  jobs at the age of 10. The jobs vary from head loader, hawker, grinder, valcanizer and much more. Martha Dung age of 12 had a near slavery experience. Her parents died so she had to live her aunt. One day her aunt told her to call a stranger uncle and obey him at all times. Then she was taken away by him to some family to work for them. She had to do a lot of the work there. One day the police caught the man she call uncle and arrested him. Now she lives in a shelter. Abraham is 14 and works as a vulcanizer. He repairs tires that have been pooped or punctured. He has to live in a horrible environment everyday. He can’t see his parents becuase he doesn't have enough money. He sleeps where he works. Sekinat is 13 and is a hawker, he sets up tables and sells goods on them. It may seem like an easy job and first, but there is a big change you might get run over by a car. His foot got run over by a car once and now its broken. Soddeg is 14 and works as a grinder. he grinds yams into a fine powder called fufu. it is a popular food. Grinding is very dangerous and with all the powder everywhere you can easily suffocate to death while you work.

Fixed

P.S. This is from Junior Scholastic[/quote][br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 16, 2008, 09:24:47 PM[/size][hr]Nigeria pumps over 2.5 million gallons of oil a year. Children and forced to pump the oil for little or no pay at all. Nigeria is one of the worlds biggest oil providers. The oil reserves are worth over 2 TRILLION dollars. but very few people get the wealth from the oil. The economy and government is corrupt. 99% of that money is either stolen by government officials directed to powerful peoples bank accounts. Kids are starting jobs at the age of 10. The jobs vary from head loader, hawker, grinder, vulcanizer and much more. Martha Dung age of 12 had a near slavery experience. Her parents died so she had to live her aunt. One day her aunt told her to call a stranger uncle and obey him at all times. Then she was taken away by him to some family to work for them. She had to do a lot of the work there. One day the police caught the man she call uncle and arrested him. Now she lives in a shelter. Abraham is 14 and works as a vulcanizer. He repairs tires that have been pooped or punctured. He has to live in a horrible environment everyday. He can’t see his parents because he doesn’t have enough money. He sleeps where he works. Sekinat is 13 and is a hawker, he sets up tables and sells goods on them. It may seem like an easy job and first, but there is a big change you might get run over by a car. His foot got run over by a car once and now its broken. Soddeg is 14 and works as a grinder. he grinds yams into a fine powder called fufu. it is a popular food. Grinding is very dangerous and with all the powder everywhere you can easily suffocate to death while you work.
